page.title: 05COTTAGE FARM (4)
page.content:
Mr. De la Haye employs five men on the farm, and uses four tractors. The chief crops are{Jersey Royal}potatoes (96 tons), which, being an early crop, are grown on the land nearest to the sea. This is less liable to frost damage because of the warm winds from the sea. Other crops are maincrop potatoes (60 tons), and sweet corn, while cauliflowers, calabrese and courgettes are grown mainy for export.
220 tons of grass are mixed with 80 tons of maize to make silage as winter feed for the cattle, and fodder-beet is grown for the same reason, while 1,000 bales of hay are also produced.
The farm has its own small reservoir, which is used for irrigation purposes in dry weather.
